shorttext.p: The gang breaks into the school swimming pool for an impromptu night of fun, but when a member of their group nearly drowns, the school threatens to expel the person responsible for the break-in. Meanwhile Chuck continues to blackmail Blair which causes strain on her already fragile relationship with Nate.

At Cannes, the guys party it up and attend to the business of selling Medellin, and find themselves with two offers on the table before it's even screened, and in the end, the film is bought from an unlikely source, at a price much lower than they were hoping for.
Season 2, Ep. 8: I Am The Table

Esteban and Nancy's spontaneous date ends in near violence. Andy and Doug successfully smuggle their first customer across the border. Silas reveals to Lisa that he grows pot, and she offers to let him do business in the back of her store.

Peter finds out that Adam wants to unleash a virus and stops him from doing so. Meanwhile, Hiro buries Adam alive. Monica is kidnapped by a street gang and Niki saves her, but gets trapped in a burning, exploding building. And Elle saves Suresh, Maya and Molly from Sylar's clutches.

Bob Harris is an American film actor, far past his prime. He visits Tokyo to appear in commercials, and he meets Charlotte, the young wife of a visiting photographer. Bored and weary, Bob and Charlotte make ideal if improbable traveling companions.

The episode opens with two men chasing each other on the causeway. When the road collapses one man is thrown into a sinkhole and killed. While investigating, the CSIs discover a conspiracy to rob a bank.

Joey and Eddie's emotional and sexual relationship is played out on stage during a counseling center benefit. At the same event, Jack and David deal with the insecurities in their relationship, Jen opens up to C.J. about Grams' cancer, and a sober Audrey returns to Boston and surprises everyone at the benefit.

The gang breaks into the school swimming pool for an impromptu night of fun, but when a member of their group nearly drowns, the school threatens to expel the person responsible for the break-in. Meanwhile Chuck continues to blackmail Blair which causes strain on her already fragile relationship with Nate.

At Cannes, the guys party it up and attend to the business of selling Medellin, and find themselves with two offers on the table before it's even screened, and in the end, the film is bought from an unlikely source, at a price much lower than they were hoping for.

Antonio Salieri believes that Mozart's music is divine. He wishes he was himself as good a musician as Mozart so that he can praise the Lord through composing. But he can't understand why God favored Mozart, such a vulgar creature, to be his instrument. Salieri's envy has made him an enemy of God whose greatness was evident in Mozart. He is set to take revenge.

A man with a low IQ has accomplished great things in his life and been present during significant historic events - in each case, far exceeding what anyone imagined he could do. It is the story of a man who rose above his challenges, and who proved that determination, courage, and love are more important than ability.

A teenager arrives who may be Meade-related. Also Henry comes back to propose to Betty, as well as Gio asking her to go to Rome with him for a holiday. Wilhelmina takes over Daniel as editor-in-chief. Lindsay Lohan is set to play an old schoolmate of Betty's.

Bob Harris is an American film actor, far past his prime. He visits Tokyo to appear in commercials, and he meets Charlotte, the young wife of a visiting photographer. Bored and weary, Bob and Charlotte make ideal if improbable traveling companions.

The episode opens with two men chasing each other on the causeway. When the road collapses one man is thrown into a sinkhole and killed. While investigating, the CSIs discover a conspiracy to rob a bank.

Jeffrey 'The Dude' Lebowski is the ultimate LA slacker, until one day his house is broken into and his rug is peed on by two angry gangsters who have mistaken him for Jeffrey Lebowski, the Los Angeles millionaire, whose wife owes some bad people some big money.

Antonio Salieri believes that Mozart's music is divine. He wishes he was himself as good a musician as Mozart so that he can praise the Lord through composing. But he can't understand why God favored Mozart, such a vulgar creature, to be his instrument. Salieri's envy has made him an enemy of God whose greatness was evident in Mozart. He is set to take revenge.
Season 3, Ep. 13: Art of the Deal

Michael and Lincoln must hand over Whistler to Gretchen so they can save LJ and Sofia's lives. Mahone seizes a golden opportunity. Meanwhile, T-Bag shows Sona who's boss and a familiar face enters Sona as another leaves it in a body bag.

Vito Corleone is the aging don of the Corleone Mafia Family. His youngest son Michael has returned from World War II just in time to see the wedding of Connie Corleone, his sister, to Carlo Rizzi. All of Michael's family is involved with the Mafia, but Michael just wants to live a normal life.

Several residents of Wisteria Lane are faced with deadly threats when Katherine's ex-husband wants to see his daughter again. Susan realizes she will soon lose her daughter when she goes off to college early, and Katherine Mayfair's secrets are finally revealed.

Cooper is held hostage by Renault, Andy and Tremayne pry into Nicky's past, Ben slips into a fantasy life as a Civil War general, James succumbs to Evelyn and Cooper's ex-partner Windom Earle leaves a gruesome scene at the Twin Peaks Sheriff's Station.

McNulty begins getting extreme amounts of unwanted attention towards his serial killer case. Because he knows this plot is one big facade, he allocates the extra man power to get other detectives real police work done, acting almost as Santa Claus: giving the detectives what they need.

The children of Salzburg are playing in the snow. Pumperl joins in the fun and jumps on some ice in the river yet starts to float away. Can the children save the dog? And what has this got to do with the big telescope?

Jeffrey 'The Dude' Lebowski is the ultimate LA slacker, until one day his house is broken into and his rug is peed on by two angry gangsters who have mistaken him for Jeffrey Lebowski, the Los Angeles millionaire, whose wife owes some bad people some big money.
